CreateUploadUrl.document:
This API is used to generate a temporary `UploadUrl` for uploading resource files (with the `HTTP PUT` method). After resource upload, `ResourceUrl` will be passed to the `TargetAction` API to complete the resource passing (specific fields vary by case). 
The data will be stored in a COS bucket in the region specified by the parameter `Region` for two hours.
CreateUploadUrl.name: Generates upload URLs

DetectReflectLivenessAndCompare.document:
This API is used to detect liveness with the package generated by the liveness comparison (reflection-based) SDK, and to compare the person detected with that in the image passed in.
The image and the data generated with the SDK must be stored in COS, and the region of the COS bucket must be same as that of requests made with this API. We recommend that you pass resources with upload link APIs.
DetectReflectLivenessAndCompare.name: Compares liveness based on reflection

GenerateReflectSequence.document:
This API is used to generate an appropriate light sequence based on the information collected by the liveness comparison (reflection-based) SDK and pass the light sequence into the SDK to start the identity verification process.
The data generated with the SDK must be stored in COS, and the region of the COS bucket must be same as that of requests made with this API. We recommend that you pass resources with upload link APIs.
GenerateReflectSequence.name: Obtains light sequences

LivenessCompare.document: This API is used to pass in a video and a photo, determine whether the person in the video is real, and if yes, then determine whether the person in the video is the same as that in the photo.
LivenessCompare.name: Detects liveness and compares faces

VideoLivenessCompare.document: This API is used to pass in URLs of a video and a photo, determine whether the person in the video is real, and if yes, then determine whether the person in the video is the same as that in the photo.
VideoLivenessCompare.name: Detects liveness and compares face based on video

members.document: Target API
members.name: TargetAction

members.document: The URL for uploading contents with the `HTTP PUT` method.
members.name: UploadUrl

members.document: The resource URL obtained after this upload is completed and to be passed in where it is required later.
members.name: ResourceUrl

members.document: The point in time when the upload/download link expires, which is a 10-bit Unix timestamp.
members.name: ExpiredTimestamp

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: URL of the liveness detection data package generated by the SDK
members.name: LiveDataUrl

members.document: MD5 hash value (32-bit) of the liveness detection data package generated by the SDK, which is used to verify the LiveData consistency.
members.name: LiveDataMd5

members.document: URL of the target image for comparison
members.name: ImageUrl

members.document: MD5 hash value (32-bit) of the target image for comparison, which is used to verify the `Image` consistency.
members.name: ImageMd5

members.document: Temporary URL of the best screenshot (.jpg) of the video after successful verification. Both the screenshot and the URL are valid for two hours only, so you need to download the screenshot within this period.
members.name: BestFrameUrl

members.document: MD5 hash value (32-bit) of the best screenshot of the video after successful verification, which is used to verify the `BestFrame` consistency.
members.name: BestFrameMd5

members.document: Service error code. `Success` will be returned for success. For error information, see the `FailedOperation` section in the error code list below.
members.name: Result

members.document: Service result description
members.name: Description

members.document: Similarity. Value range: [0.00, 100.00]. As a recommendation, when the similarity is greater than or equal to 70, it can be determined that the two faces are of the same person. You can adjust the threshold according to your specific scenario (the FAR at the threshold of 70 is 0.1%, and FAR at the threshold of 80 is 0.01%).
members.name: Sim

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

FileInfo.document: The description of a file, including a download URL and the MD5 checksum and size of the file.

members.document: The URL for downloading the file
members.name: Url

members.document: The 32-bit MD5 checksum of the file
members.name: MD5

members.document: The file size
members.name: Size

members.document: The resource URL of the data package generated by the SDK.
members.name: DeviceDataUrl

members.document: The MD5 hash value of the data package generated by the SDK.
members.name: DeviceDataMd5

members.document:
1 - silent
2 - blinking
3 - light
4 - blinking + light (default)
members.name: SecurityLevel

members.document: The resource URL of the light sequence, which needs to be downloaded and passed through to the SDK to start the identity verification process.
members.name: ReflectSequenceUrl

members.document: The MD5 hash value of the light sequence, which is used to check whether the light sequence is altered.
members.name: ReflectSequenceMd5

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Liveness detection type. Valid values: LIP/ACTION/SILENT.
LIP: numeric mode; ACTION: motion mode; SILENT: silent mode. You need to select a mode to input.
members.name: LivenessType

members.document:
Base64 string of the image for face comparison.
The size of the Base64-encoded image data can be up to 3 MB. JPG and PNG formats are supported.
Please use the standard Base64 encoding scheme (with the "=" padding). For the encoding conventions, please see RFC 4648.

Either the `ImageUrl` or `ImageBase64` of the image must be provided. If both are provided, only `ImageBase64` will be used.
members.name: ImageBase64

members.document:
URL of the image for face comparison. The size of the downloaded image after Base64 encoding can be up to 3 MB. JPG and PNG formats are supported.

Either the `ImageUrl` or `ImageBase64` of the image must be provided. If both are provided, only `ImageBase64` will be used.

We recommend you store the image in Tencent Cloud, as a Tencent Cloud URL can guarantee higher download speed and stability. The download speed and stability of non-Tencent Cloud URLs may be low.
members.name: ImageUrl

members.document:
Lip mode: set this parameter to a custom 4-digit verification code.
Action mode: set this parameter to a custom action sequence (e.g., `2,1` or `1,2`).
Silent mode: do not pass in this parameter.
members.name: ValidateData
Optional

members.document:
Base64 string of the video for liveness detection.
The size of the Base64-encoded video data can be up to 8 MB. MP4, AVI, and FLV formats are supported.
Please use the standard Base64 encoding scheme (with the "=" padding). For the encoding conventions, please see RFC 4648.

Either the `VideoUrl` or `VideoBase64` of the video must be provided. If both are provided, only `VideoBase64` will be used.
members.name: VideoBase64

members.document:
URL of the video for liveness detection. The size of the downloaded video after Base64 encoding can be up to 8 MB. It takes no more than 4 seconds to download. MP4, AVI, and FLV formats are supported.

Either the `VideoUrl` or `VideoBase64` of the video must be provided. If both are provided, only `VideoBase64` will be used.

We recommend you store the video in Tencent Cloud, as a Tencent Cloud URL can guarantee higher download speed and stability. The download speed and stability of non-Tencent Cloud URLs may be low.
members.name: VideoUrl

members.document: The best screenshot of the video after successful verification. The photo is Base64-encoded and in JPG format.
members.name: BestFrameBase64

members.document: Similarity. Value range: [0.00, 100.00]. As a recommendation, when the similarity is greater than or equal to 70, it can be determined that the two faces are of the same person. You can adjust the threshold according to your specific scenario (the FAR at the threshold of 70 is 0.1%, and FAR at the threshold of 80 is 0.01%).
members.name: Sim

members.document: Service error code. `Success` will be returned for success. For error information, please see the `FailedOperation` section in the error code list below.
members.name: Result

members.document: Service result description.
members.name: Description

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
The URL of the photo for face comparison. The downloaded image after Base64 encoding can be up to 3 MB and must be in JPG or PNG.

The image must be stored in a COS bucket in the region where the FaceID service resides to ensure a higher download speed and better stability. You can generate an image URL by using `CreateUploadUrl` or purchase the COS service.
members.name: ImageUrl

members.document: The 32-bit MD5 checksum of the image for comparison
members.name: ImageMd5

members.document:
The URL of the video for liveness detection. The downloaded video after Base64 encoding can be up to 8 MB and must be in MP4, AVI, or FLV. It takes no more than 4s to download the video.

The video must be stored in a COS bucket in the region where the FaceID service resides to ensure a higher download speed and better stability. You can generate a video URL by using `CreateUploadUrl` or purchase the COS service.
members.name: VideoUrl

members.document: The 32-bit MD5 checksum of the video
members.name: VideoMd5

members.document:
The liveness detection type. Valid values: `LIP`, `ACTION`, and `SILENT`.
`LIP`: Numeric mode; `ACTION`: Motion mode; `SILENT`: silent mode. Select one of them.
members.name: LivenessType

members.document:
LIP parameter: Pass in a custom 4-digit verification code.
ACTION parameter: Pass in a custom action sequence (`2,1` or `1,2`).
SILENT parameter: Null.
members.name: ValidateData

members.document: The similarity. Value range: [0.00, 100.00]. As a recommendation, when the similarity is greater than or equal to 70, it can be determined that the two persons are of the same person. You can adjust the threshold according to your specific scenario (the FARs at the thresholds of 70 and 80 are 0.1% and 0.01%, respectively).
members.name: Sim

members.document: The service error code. `Success` will be returned for success. For error information, see the `FailedOperation` section in the error code list below.
members.name: Result

members.document: The service result description
members.name: Description

members.document:
The best video screenshot after successful verification
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BestFrame

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId
